Are these questions still Valid ?

C. The Integrated Information Infrastructure Model

This component of TOGAF is designed to enable architects to design architectures that achieve Boundaryless Information Flow.
it should be C. The Integrated Information Infrastructure REFERENCE Model.
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
Basic Concepts
Background
The III-RM is a subset of the TOGAF TRM in terms of its overall scope, but it also expands certain parts of the TRM - in particular, the business applications and infrastructure applications parts - in order to provide help in addressing one of the key challenges facing the enterprise architect today: the need to design an integrated information infrastructure to enable Boundaryless Information Flow. These concepts are explained in detail below.
This introductory section examines the concept of Boundaryless Information Flow; why an integrated information infrastructure is necessary to enable it; and how the III-RM can help the architect in designing an integrated information infrastructure for their enterprise.


https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf8-doc/arch/chap22.html

Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer: C

Correct Answer -- C 

35.4.1 Architecture Continuum
Common Systems Architectures
The TOGAF Integrated Information Infrastructure Reference Model (III-RM) - see the TOGAF® Series Guide: The TOGAF Integrated Information Infrastructure Reference Model (III-RM) - is a reference model that supports describing Common Systems Architecture in the Application Domain that focuses on the requirements, building blocks, and standards relating to the vision of Boundaryless Information Flow.
C is correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following TOGAF components was created to enable architects to design architectures addressing Boundaryless Information Flow?
According to TOGAF, which of the following best describes how the Enterprise Continuum is used in organizing and developing an architecture?

choices.D: It is used to provide a system for continuous monitoring
choices.E: It is used to structure re-usable architecture and solution assets
choices.B: It is used to describe how an architecture addresses stakeholder concerns
choices.A: It is used to coordinate with the other management frameworks in use
choices.C: It is used to identify and understand business requirements

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
Enterprise Continuum--> re-usability

Selected Answer: E
35.1 Overview

The Enterprise Continuum enables the organization of re-usable architecture artifacts and solution assets to maximize the Enterprise Architecture investment opportunities.



https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/m/chap35.html

Selected Answer: E
E. It is used to structure re-usable architecture and solution assets

Correct Answer 

35.1 Overview

The Enterprise Continuum enables the organization of re-usable architecture artifacts and solution assets to maximize the Enterprise Architecture investment opportunities.

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. TOGAF defines five criteria for a good set of principles: Understandable, Robust, Complete, Consistent and_____.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
20.4 Developing Architecture Principles
20.4.1 Qualities of Principles
Understandable: the underlying tenets can be quickly grasped and understood by individuals throughout the organization
Robust: enable good quality decisions about architectures and plans to be made, and enforceable policies and standards to be created
Complete: every potentially important principle governing the management of information and technology for the organization is defined - the principles cover every situation perceived
Consistent: strict adherence to one principle may require a loose interpretation of another principle
Stable: principles should be enduring, yet able to accommodate changes
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap20.html

Selected Answer: E
20.4.1 Qualities of Principles


https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap20.html

Selected Answer: E
E. Stable

Correct Answer 

SUR - CC

3. Definitions
3.17 Architecture View
A representation of a system from the perspective of a related set of concerns.
Note:
In some sections of this standard, the term "view" is used as a synonym for "architecture view".

Selected Answer: A
31.1 Basic Concepts
An "architecture view" is a representation of a system from the perspective of a related set of concerns. It consists of one or more architecture models of the system.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap31.html

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. According to TOGAF, a ______________is a representation of a system from the perspective of a related set of_____________.

choices.D: A repository area holding processes to support governance of the Architecture Repository
choices.E: A repository area holding specifications to which architectures must conform
choices.A: A repository area holding a description of the organization specific architecture framework and method
choices.B: A repository area holding a record of the governance activity across the enterprise
choices.C: A repository area holding guidelines and templates used to create new architectures

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes the Standards Information Base?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
37. Architecture Repository
37.4 Standards Information Base
37.4.1 Overview
The Standards Information Base provides a repository area to hold a set of specifications, to which architectures must conform. Establishment of a Standards Information Base provides an unambiguous basis for Architecture Governance because:

The standards are easily accessible to projects and therefore the obligations of the project can be understood and planned for
Standards are stated in a clear and unambiguous manner, so that compliance can be objectively assessed

Selected Answer: E
37.4 Standards Information Base
37.4.1 Overview
The Standards Information Base provides a repository area to hold a set of specifications, to which architectures must conform. Establishment of a Standards Information Base provides an unambiguous basis for Architecture Governance because:
• The standards are easily accessible to projects and therefore the obligations of the project can be understood and planned for
• Standards are stated in a clear and unambiguous manner, so that compliance can be objectively assessed
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap37.html

Selected Answer: E
E. A repository area holding specifications to which architectures must conform
